definition.name: NXcrystal_structure

symbol.name: n_hkl
symbol.doc: Number of reflectors (Miller crystallographic plane triplets).

definition.doc:
Base class to describe the atomic crystal structure of a phase.
This base class contains key metadata that are relevant parameter to every physics-based model to simulate radiation matter interaction.
Examples where such base class is useful are kinematic or dynamic diffraction simulations of e.g. (Kikuchi or other type of) patterns.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: Detail in which reference frame the unit cell is defined.

field.name: dimensionality
field.doc: Dimensionality of the lattice.

group.name: reference
group.doc: Reference to another resource that was used for instantiating this structure model.

field.name: a_b_c
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell parameters a, b, and c.

field.name: alpha_beta_gamma
field.doc: Crystallography unit cell parameters alpha, beta, and gamma.

field.name: area
field.doc: Area of the unit cell considering that d = 2.

field.name: volume
field.doc: Volume of the unit cell considering that d = 3.

field.name: crystal_system
field.doc: Crystal system

field.name: laue_group
field.doc: Laue group using International Table of Crystallography Notation.

field.name: point_group
field.doc: Point group using International Table of Crystallography Notation.

field.name: space_group
field.doc: Space group from the International Table of Crystallography Notation.

field.name: is_centrosymmetric
field.doc: True if space group is considered a centrosymmetric one. False if space group is considered a non-centrosymmetric one. Centrosymmetric has all types and combinations of symmetry elements (translation, rotational axis, mirror planes, center of inversion) Non-centrosymmetric compared to centrosymmetric is constrained (no inversion). Chiral compared to non-centrosymmetric is constrained (no mirror planes).

field.name: is_chiral
field.doc: True if space group is considered a chiral one. False if space group is consider a non-chiral one.

field.name: phase_identifier
field.doc:
Identifier for each phase.
The value 0 is reserved for the unknown phase that represents the null-model no sufficiently significant confirmation. In other words, the phase_name is n/a, notIndexed.
The phase identifier value has to match with the integer postfix of the group name which represents that instance in a NeXus/HDF5 file, i.e. if two phases were used e.g. 0 and 1, two instances of an :ref:`NXcrystal_structure` named phase0 and phase1 should be stored in the HDF5 file.

field.name: phase_name
field.doc:
Name of the phase/alias.
If the phase_identifier is 0 and one would like to use the field phase_name the value should be n/a.

field.name: atom_identifier
field.doc: Label for each atom position.

field.name: atom_type
field.doc: The hash value :math:`H` is :math:`H = Z + N \cdot 256` with :math:`Z` the number of protons and :math:`N` the number of neutrons of each isotope respectively. :math:`Z` and :math:`N` have to be 8-bit unsigned integers. For the rationale behind this `M. KÃ¼hbach et al. (2021) <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927621012241>`_

field.name: atom_position
field.doc: Atom positions.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: Reference to an instance of :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` whereby the positions can be resolved.

field.name: atom_occupancy
field.doc: Relative occupancy of the atom position.

field.name: number_of_planes
field.doc:
How many reflectors are distinguished.
Value has to match value for symbol n_hkl.

field.name: miller
field.doc:
Miller indices :math:`(hkl)[uvw]` of the planes.
The first triplet specify :math:`(hkl)` the second triplet :math:`[uvw]`. Miller indices refer to the Cartesian right-handed coordinate system of the unit cell.

field.name: dspacing
field.doc: Spacing between crystallographic planes as defined by field miller.

field.name: relative_intensity
field.doc: Relative intensity of the signal for the plane.

field.name: number_of_scan_points
field.doc: In case the :ref:`NXcrystal_structure` base class is used with analyzed orientation maps this field stores how many scan points of the map were identified as that phase.
